intro: Leiothrix lanifera, commonly known as the silky leiothrix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
